Topic.Title: have $255 puts

Message.Msg: Not true sybs. While I generally agree that the FIDO cartel has used options to manipulate the price, it is still a chicken and egg question. Do they control the stock, and therefore know which way to bet on the options, or control the options and thereby move the stock price. It is the cartel that moves the underlying commodity. All options are are leveraged bets on the underlying. Get the direction wrong and lose a boatload. Get it right, and the leverage is your friend. That said, weeklies are historically the dumbest, most expensive purchase on the planet. I do not think this is the end for AMZN. Tomorrow it will fall with the overall market, but I would be surprised to see it settle below 255. In other words, angel will lose everything.

Message.Msg: Factors which will adversely affect AMZN. The weak economic environment which we will experience in the consumer sector. Macroeconomic trends point downward, austerity you know. This weakness will primarily affect AMZN’s consumers, current data suggests at best, sales will be sluggish, a major negative for their organic sales traffic. These weaknesses will have significant impact on this stock’s trend. Implied growth rate will see weakness, a negative for their cash flow. Topic.Title: Grasso says buy. Manager's have to own this into yr end.

Message.Msg: Interesting paradox for Wall Street. It wants retail investors to rotate out of treasuries and put money at risk, but protects AMZN because it is too big to fail -- until institutions unload enough overvalued stock on retail. Go figure. When the institutions stop proecting the bubble valuations, trust will come back and money will rotate into the market. But, instead, they hammer Apple and protect Amazon. Last time I checked, AAPL not only had huge cash, earnings and cash flow, but had higher TTM revenue growth than Amazon as well. There is simply no way any rational human being can defend the moves in AAPL and AMZN as being anything other than predatory -- designed to shake out weak hands (aka retail) -- in nature.

Topic.Title: Did Any Of You Short Idiots See How Much Real Estate AMZN Bought?????

Message.Msg: In Dubai they built the 150 story Burq Dubai right before their economy imploded; in Malasia they built the 120 story Petronas towers right before the Asian Tiger crisis, many many examples.Skyscraper building booms are signs of excess and often signs of an impending economic collapse. If Amazon had oodles of cash like Apple, fine, build (Apple is planning a giant new HQ). But how much cash is Amazon using to build these monuments? Shareholders should be asking questions. Why not pay a dividend instead? Isn't there plenty of empty office space in Seattle? Lease!
